oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Hill Family Home
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Home belonging to Dr. Lafayette Hill, located on Maple Street. There is a horse-drawn carriage in front of the house.

Dr Lafayette Hill Sr. (1825-1892)This house burned in the late 1960's. Several generations of Hill family children and grandchildren were born in this home. Lafayette's son, Lafayette Hill, Jr. also went on to become a doctor. Dr. Hill, Sr's. wife, Seraphina Catherine Tipton Hill (1830-1888) was a granddaughter of Capt. Jacob Tipton (1765-1791), of whom Tipton County was named after.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Looking Back at Tennessee Photograph Collection, 1890-1981
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Carriages & coaches; Horses; Fences; Buildings; Streets; Houses; Couples; Trees
